snippet: France on Thursday ruled out a “military solution” in its former colony of Mali to counter rebels in the north.
abstract: West Africa’s regional trade bloc begins drawing up plans for military action to tackle the twin crises of a coup and a rebellion in Mali, as Tuareg rebels who have seized control over much of the north country declare a cease-fire in their drive to create an independent homeland.

byline.original: By LYDIA POLGREEN and ALAN COWELL

lead_paragraph: France on Thursday ruled out a “military solution” in its former colony of Mali to counter rebels in the north.

headline.seo: France Rules Out Sending Troops to Mali as Rebels Proclaim Cease-Fire
headline.main: France Rules Out Sending Troops to Mali as Rebels Proclaim Ceasefire
headline.print_headline: After Seizing Land, Rebels In Mali Declare Cease-Fire

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
keywords.name: subject
